alert.note: Alert for Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 11 at 7:01AM PDT until October 12 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 degrees possible for western Nevada, and lower-mid 20s for northeast California including Surprise Valley. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California, Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties, Northern Washoe County, Greater Reno-Carson City- Minden Area, Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties and Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warmer urban areas around Reno will only dip into the lower-mid 30s. Other valleys in western Nevada including around Minden and Smith Valley have a 50-80% chance of dropping below 32 degrees for 4-6 hours late tonight into Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
